title: Judge Jackson and the Biology of Gender
sub_head: Ketanji Brown Jackson is already issuing interesting opinions and she’s not even on the Supreme Court yet.
body:
Senate confirmation hearings can be tedious affairs with presidential nominees often appearing as if they’ve been coached by the fictional baseball player Crash Davis in the art of the cliché. Especially since the hearings for Judge Robert Bork in 1987, Supreme Court nominees have seemed to be especially diligent in attempting to say nothing of note.
It’s not clear if this was the intention of Supreme Court nominee Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson this week, but a question from Sen. Marsha Blackburn (R., Tenn.) elicited an interesting answer. Here’s the exchange:
